definitions.definition: the action of forming something; the process of being formed

examples.text: the formation of a new government
evidence of recent star formation in the galaxy
This dispute led to the formation of a new breakaway group.
the top civil servants who are responsible for policy formation

definitions.definition: a thing that has been formed, especially in a particular place or in a particular way

examples.text: Massive rock formations rise abruptly some 1 500 feet above the canyon floor.
The team usually plays in a 4-4-2 formation.
The troops advanced in battle formation.
changing patterns of marriage and family formation

wordOrigin: late Middle English: from Latin formatio(n-), from formare ‘to form’, based on Latin forma ‘a mould or form’.
